data.title: Adam Smith College
data.meta_description: RMJM was commissioned to redevelop Adam Smith College's St Brycedale Campus; a complex, project incorporating demolition, new build and refurbishment works.
data.text:
RMJM was commissioned in 2001 for the redevelopment of Adam Smith College’s St Brycedale Campus. This was a complex, multi-phase project on a live site, incorporating demolition, new build and refurbishment works.

The campus is located in the historic town centre of Kirkcaldy and RMJM’s architectural solution found a balance between the civic setting and the contemporary image of the College.

A five storey glazed tower signifies the entrance to the campus, complementary in scale to the surrounding historic roof-tops and towers. Two dramatic multi-storey spaces have been created internally. ‘The Atrium’ sits within the retained listed building, whilst ‘The Street’ separates old from new.
